title: Rewterz Threat Advisory Multiple Apple iOS and iPadOS Vulnerabilities

meta.title: Rewterz Threat Advisory Multiple Apple iOS and iPadOS Vulnerabilities

chapters.title: Rewterz Threat Advisory Multiple Apple iOS and iPadOS Vulnerabilities

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by an out-of-bounds write issue in the AVEVideoEncoder component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by an out-of-bounds write issue in the AVEVideoEncoder component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by an out-of-bounds access issue in the DriverKit component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with system privileges.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by an out-of-bounds access issue in the DriverKit component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with system privileges.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a memory corruption issue in the GPU Drivers component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a memory corruption issue in the GPU Drivers component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow in the ImageIO component. By persuading a victim to open a specially crafted file, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system or cause a denial of service.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code on the system, caused by an integer overflow in the ImageIO component. By persuading a victim to open a specially crafted file, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the system or cause a denial of service.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a race condition in the IOKit component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a race condition in the IOKit component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a memory corruption issue in the IOMobileFrameBuffer component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a memory corruption issue in the IOMobileFrameBuffer component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a memory corruption issue in the Kernel component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a memory corruption issue in the Kernel component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a use-after-free in the Kernel component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to gain elevated privileges on the system, caused by a use-after-free in the Kernel component. By using a specially crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with kernel privileges.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a race condition in the Kernel component. By using a specially-crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass Pointer Authentication.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a race condition in the Kernel component. By using a specially-crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass Pointer Authentication.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an access issue in the LaunchServices component. By using a specially-crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to circumvent sandbox restrictions.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by an access issue in the LaunchServices component. By using a specially-crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to circumvent sandbox restrictions.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a flaw in the Notes component. By processing a large input, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS are vulnerable to a denial of service, caused by a flaw in the Notes component. By processing a large input, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a denial of service.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a logic issue in the Safari Private Browsing component. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to track users in Safari private browsing mode.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a logic issue in the Safari Private Browsing component. By persuading a victim to visit a specially-crafted Web site, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to track users in Safari private browsing mode.

sentences.text: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a certificate parsing issue in the Security component. By using a specially-crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass signature validation.
sentences.html: Apple iOS and iPadOS could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions, caused by a certificate parsing issue in the Security component. By using a specially-crafted application, an attacker could exploit this vulnerability to bypass signature validation.

sentences.text: Refer to Apple security document for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
sentences.html: Refer to Apple security document for patch, upgrade or suggested workaround information. See References.
